intro: Dehaasia rangamattiensis, commonly known as the Rangamati dehaasia, is a rare flowering plant native to the northeastern region of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in dense forest undergrowth. Its unique morphology and restricted distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered, highlighting the need for its protection.
